title: @KateyKhaos - Any new Cassio skins in discussions or brought up? #ElderwoodCassopeia please.
body:
Cassiopeia has not had a skin in a really long time and even the skins she has now aren't that great! A fiery skin (lavaesque for ult to turn them into molten rock) or even an ice skin (for obvious reasons) would be cool, but with the addition of the Elderwood line I think it would be amazing for her!

Q -  just the typical poison mist cloud (maybe a lighter purple or blue)

W - a ground full of purple or blue mist with mushrooms growing out of it. Maybe have the mushrooms letting out the poison.

E - a thorn from a plant or something similar. 

R - Her ult could entangle them in vines or maybe even just turn them into petrified wood kind of look. 

I wish I was a great artist so I could draw all this out for everyone, but it looks good in my imagination haha.

replies.body:
Hey! 

Cassiopeia was off the market for a bit due to her update with the bulk mage roster update, which explains the more recent lack of love in terms of skins for Cassiopeia. Now that it's out of the way and on live, she's back on our eligible list! While I can't spill the beans on what we may or may not have planned at the moment, I can assure you that she's on our minds as a champion who hasn't had a skin in a while, and could certainly use one. :)

Are there champions that are especially hard to come up with skins for?  Do you guys usually start from the thematic and ouch the best Champs for that or start with a champ and be like what would be a cool skin for this guy

Some are harder than others! 

We usually start with - 

- Take a champion and brainstorm ideas.
- Take a thematic (PROJECT) and brainstorm who would work well with said thematic.

Beyond things like Visual and Gameplay Updates, are there reasons why champions are put off the market when it comes to skins?
Like for example Diana went almost 2.5 years without a skin. The only reason she even got Infernal was because people voted she got it. She wasn't listed for any kind of update over the last two years, and it doesn't really explain Riots thoughts when it comes to choosing skins. If the current quantity of skins a champion has isn't taken into account, what is? 
Was it due to controversy over Diana being possibly homosexual? It wouldn't shock me considering Taric as well.
There are a large quantity of Champions who fit this list such as Karma and Trundle.

Well, what do Diana, Trundle (before the last year), Karma (before the last 6 months), and Taric (before the rework) have in common?  Also in common with other non-skin-getters like Urgot.  

They just weren't that popular.  That doesn't put them off the market, it just makes them farther back in line.

(Tbh not interested in a non-red-comment)
That's a balant excuse.
Going off of that logic Janna should have seen a skin easily in the last 2-3 years, yet she hasn't. 
Same goes for Irelia, who has always maintained a solid playrate. 
As much as it might be "Does not pull them off the market", how long is the list in that 4 years is excuseable for any champion?
Malzahar could use one too. his only particle changing skin is LE, but snow day malzahar doesnt even come close to capturing his badassness
Yay I can't wait!!! Also can't wait for the reveal of these new Star Guardians! The suspense is going to kill me!

The MYM update happened over 4.5 months ago, since then plenty of skins for various themes have been released and yet none of these opportunities were taken to include Cassiopeia in any of them. Could it be that your team is reluctant to work on her just because she doesn't have any legs?

Her design is truly unique and her fanart really embodies what kind of potential there is in turning a snakelady into an evil queen, an alien invader, a cyborg, a raidboss, a maiden, an aztec goddess, an undead horror, a noblewoman, a hextech steam serpent, an elderwood being, an ionian seductress, a vicious centipede, an elemental spirit, a shuriman empress, a vile demon and *so much more*. I could go on forever, literally.

Neither the recent nor the upcoming skin releases (Star Guardians + ultimate skin) have any plans of featuring her, she simply remains unloved. When is this finally going to change? We know that she's eligible for something new, so *please* take the chance before it'll be actually 4 years since her last skin release.

Riot has stated that skins take at least 6 months usually between concept, 3D art, finalizing, bug testing (oh the joyful bugs skins introduce to League on a regular basis) and release, and that's assuming that it doesn't get scrapped because one of those steps just proved too difficult to succeed in (that's why we don't have Gentleman Zac for instance).

It's extremely rare for a champ to get a skin right after a rework; Pool Party Taric was more the ~~[outrageous]~~ exception than the rule.
When and where did they say that? Katey told me something entirely different back in May when I brought up the topic: http://i.imgur.com/SIHc6kI.png
What about Death Blossom?

The Death Blossom skin line is dedicated to Insects who disguise themselves as Flowers.
I.e Death Blossom Elise and Kha'zix.

> [{quoted}](name=Jackalopeer,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vELz7iX5,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2016-09-16T07:42:10.651+0000)
>
> The Death Blossom skin line is dedicated to Insects who disguise themselves as Flowers.
> I.e Death Blossom Elise and Kha'zix.

Spiders are not insects. :)
same diff, Arachnid. They all have too many legs.

> [{quoted}](name=Jackalopeer,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vELz7iX5,comment-id=0000000100000000,timestamp=2016-09-16T15:29:09.874+0000)
>
> same diff, Arachnid. They all have too many legs.

Nah mate. It is like amphibians and reptiles. They have clear differences. 

Death Blossom has no clear theme. If it had, it would be shame anyway. It would be shame to have no possiblity for future Death Blossom Zyra skin.

Except that Kindlejack confirmed it himself that the Death Blossom skin line was built around/dedicated to invertebrate that disguise themselves as plants?

"Death Blossom is inspired by insects (and arachnids) that camouflage by taking on the appearance of flowers. Species of mantis and spider are well known for this trait, hence Elise and Kha'zix sharing this theme."

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/wmkMgfAX-the-next-arcade-skin

The bottom paragraph of the 20th red comment along. 

It's not impossible for a Death Blossom Zyra to happen, but the skin line does have a very clear theme.

> [{quoted}](name=Jackalopeer,realm=OCE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=vELz7iX5,comment-id=000000010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-09-16T18:03:19.160+0000)
>
> Except that Kindlejack confirmed it himself that the Death Blossom skin line was a skin line built around/dedicated invertebrate that disguise themselves as plants?
> 
> "Death Blossom is inspired by insects (and arachnids) that camouflage by taking on the appearance of flowers. Species of mantis and spider are well known for this trait, hence Elise and Kha'zix sharing this theme."
> 
> http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/skin-champion-concepts/wmkMgfAX-the-next-arcade-skin
> 
> The bottom paragraph of the 20th red comment along. 
> 
> It's not impossible for a Death Blossom Zyra to happen, but the skin has a very clear theme.

Cool then, sorry.
Yes!  Found it odd Kha got one

It's been 1315 days since her last one (Jade Fang Cass) came out and still no trace of a Cass skin. I simply don't get how they can neglect her for so long despite the countless amazing fanconcepts out there.
Yes. That completely baffles me. Especially since she's somewhat had a graphic update. And she's fairly popular now
